metadata.name: Computer Discovery And Export Via Get-ADComputer Cmdlet - PowerShell
metadata.comment: Detects usage of the Get-ADComputer cmdlet to collect computer information and output it to a file

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('get-adcomputer ')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower(' -filter *')) AND (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower(' | select ')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('out-file')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('set-content')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('add-content'))))

output.summary: Detects usage of the Get-ADComputer cmdlet to collect computer information and output it to a file

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate admin scripts may use the same technique, it's better to exclude specific computers or users who execute these commands or scripts often References: http://blog.talosintelligence.com/2022/09/lazarus-three-rats.html, https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/security/blog/2022/10/18/defenders-beware-a-case-for-post-ransomware-investigations/, https://www.cisa.gov/uscert/sites/default/files/publications/aa22-320a_joint_csa_iranian_government-sponsored_apt_actors_compromise_federal%20network_deploy_crypto%20miner_credential_harvester.pdf
